speaker: Clearing
lines: Ferns tilt like listeners; their fronds have questions.
Midges halo a stump that thinks it is a throne.
A scarf hangs on a branch and flaps in a wind that is not here.
The air tastes of mint and old fire.
A circle of stones argues about whether it is a circle.
Someone has left three berries on a flat rock: two red, one apology.
A root crosses the dirt like a sentence; it could be a warning or a welcome.
Your name sounds different when you say it under these leaves.

choices.text: Sit on the stump and listen back.
Take a berry you think is safe.
